metadata.case_name: State of Assam v. Respondent No. 1

facts.text: Appeal by special leave from judgment and order dated June 2, 1966 of Assam and Nagaland High Court at Gauhati in Civil Rule No. 7 of 1966.

Section 7A inserted in Industrial Disputes Act, 1947 by Act No. 36 of 1956 with effect from March 10, 1957, providing for constitution of Industrial Tribunals and qualifications for presiding officer.

Assam Act No. 8 of 1952 (assent April 25, 1962) inserted cl. (aa) in s.7A(3) after cl.(a): he has worked as District Judge or Additional District Judge or both for total period not less than three years or qualified for High Court judge, with proviso for consultation with Assam High Court.
Industrial Disputes Amendment Act No. 36 of 1964 inserted cl.(aa) in s.7A(3) after cl.(a): he has for period not less than three years been a District Judge or Additional District Judge.
By order dated December 7, 1965, State Government appointed Shri B.C. Dutta as Presiding Officer of Industrial Tribunal, Assam, Gauhati.
Respondent No.1 filed writ petition in Assam High Court challenging appointment of Shri Dutta; High Court quashed appointment holding Shri Dutta lacked qualification under s.7A(3).

Assam Judicial Service (Senior) Rules, 1952: Strength - Senior Grade I (Registrar, District Judges: 3); Senior Grade II (Additional District Judges: 3). Governor power to increase cadre. Registrar post filled by Chief Justice preferably from Grade I or II.
On August 16, 1954, Shri Dutta, then Officiating Subordinate and Assistant Sessions Judge, appointed temporary Additional District Sessions Judge.
While officiating as Additional District Judge, services lent to High Court, temporarily promoted to Senior Grade I, appointed Registrar of Assam High Court on March 8, 1957 by Chief Justice.
Undisputed that between August 16, 1954 and March 8, 1957 Shri Dutta held office of Additional District Judge.
Record shows Government continued to retain Shri Dutta in office of Additional District Judge until April 24, 1958.
On March 26, 1958, Shri Dutta confirmed in Senior Grade II w.e.f. February 16, 1957; on April 24, 1958 confirmed in Senior Grade I w.e.f. May 2, 1957.
Shri Dutta retired from office of Registrar on June 30, 1959.
High Court held post of Registrar separate from District Judge; Shri Dutta never held office of District Judge.
Before December 7, 1965, Shri Dutta had been Presiding Officer of a Labour Court for over two years.
Appointment of Shri Dutta made without consultation with High Court.

legal_issues.text: Whether respondent No. 2, Shri B. C. Dutta was qualified for appointment as the Presiding Officer of an Industrial Tribunal under s. 7A(3) of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947.
Whether Shri Dutta, while working as Registrar of the Assam High Court, continued to hold the office of an Additional District Judge.
Whether actual work as Additional District Judge for three years was required under s.7A(3)(aa), or merely holding the office.
Whether appointment without consultation with High Court violated proviso to cl.(aa) inserted by Assam Act No.8 of 1962.
Whether Shri Dutta qualified under s.7A(3)(b) as having held office of member of a Tribunal, based on service as Presiding Officer of Labour Court.

petitioner_arguments.text: Shri Dutta had been an Additional District Judge for over three years and was therefore qualified for appointment under s.7A(3)(aa).
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.7A(3)(aa) Industrial Disputes Act as inserted by Act 36/1964

respondent_arguments.text: Appointment quashed as Shri Dutta lacked qualification under s.7A(3); post of Registrar separate, never held office of District Judge.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: s.7A(3) Industrial Disputes Act; Assam Judicial Service (Senior) Rules, 1952

respondent_arguments.text: Appointment made without consultation with High Court, non-compliance with proviso to s.7A(3)(aa) inserted by Assam Act No.8 of 1962.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Proviso to s.7A(3)(aa) Assam Act No.8 of 1962

court_reasoning.text: Shri Dutta continued to hold office of Additional District Judge from March 8, 1957 to April 24, 1958 while officiating as Registrar; total period over three years from 1954.
court_reasoning.key_observation: High Court omitted to consider whether he continued to hold office of Additional District Judge after March 8, 1957.

court_reasoning.text: To satisfy s.7A(3)(aa), not necessary to actually work as Additional District Judge for three years; holding the office suffices.
court_reasoning.key_observation: High Court erred in thinking actual work required.

court_reasoning.text: Cl.(aa) inserted by Central Act 36/1964 impliedly repealed cl.(aa) by Assam Act to extent of repugnancy; Central Act exhaustive, no consultation required; repugnant proviso void under Art.254.
Labour Court is not a Tribunal under s.7A(3)(b) read with s.2(r); s.2(r) definition refers to Industrial Tribunal under s.7A or pre-1957 s.7.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Shri Dutta not qualified under s.7A(3)(b).

holdings.text: Shri Dutta qualified under s.7A(3)(aa) as having held office of Additional District Judge for over three years.
No requirement for actual work as Additional District Judge; holding office sufficient.
Proviso to Assam cl.(aa) void due to repugnancy with Central Act 36/1964; no consultation needed.
Labour Court not a Tribunal for s.7A(3)(b).

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Qualifications for Presiding Officer of Industrial Tribunal; definition of Tribunal

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes (Appellate Tribunal) Act, 1950

statutes_cited.name: Assam Act No. 8 of 1952
statutes_cited.relevance: Inserted cl.(aa) with consultation proviso; repugnant and void to extent

statutes_cited.relevance: Inserted exhaustive cl.(aa) without proviso; repeals Assam clause

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Repugnancy between Central and State laws; State law void to extent

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; High Court order quashed; appointment of Shri Dutta as Presiding Officer upheld as valid under s.7A(3)(aa) of Industrial Disputes Act.
outcome.relief_granted: Set aside High Court order quashing appointment

key_quotes.text: We are satisfied that during the period from March 8, 1957 up to April 24, 1958, Shri Dutta, while officiating as a Registrar of the High Court, continued to hold the office of an Additional District Judge.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Key finding on continuation of holding office

key_quotes.text: To satisfy the requirements of s. 7A(3)(aa) it was not necessary that he must have actually worked as an Additional District Judge for this period.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Clarifies interpretation of 'been a District Judge'

key_quotes.text: Clause (aa) inserted by the Central Act is intended to be an exhaustive code in respect of this subject-matter. The Central Act now occupies this field.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Basis for implied repeal and repugnancy under Art.254
